post.author: Zasz
post.title: From The Studio To Release
post.content:
When you got a working site in Visual Studio

  1. First thing you'll be having "debug=true" attribute as part of all the page directives. Take all this out to secure your site and increase performance. Now debug symbols and code are not inserted into the end result
  2. Modify Web.Config to include <customErrors> Section to default redirect errors that might just creep in, to user friendly Aspx or Html. There is no end to web.config based modification. For full schema of elements in web.config and their meaning go to MSDN
  3. ASP.NET applies configuration settings to resources in a hierarchical manner. Web.config files supply configuration information to the directories in which they are located and to all child directories. The configuration settings for a Web resource are supplied by the configuration file located in the same directory as the resource and by all configuration files in all parent directories
  4. Optimizations such as white-space-stripping-csshandler and RegEx-preprocessing-JScripthandlers go a long way improving network load reduction and caching.
  5. DiscountASP.net is the best host i've seen but they are not cheap. See for yourself, there are other hosts: Choose one that offers:
    1. ASP.NET 3.5 hosting
    2. MS SQL 2005 (or) MS SQL 2008 hosting
    3. Unlimited(or suitably large) Access hosting
    4. IIS 6 is fine but IIS 7 in ASP.NET Integration mode is way better as available in DiscounASP
    5. Atleast 500 mb webspace & 50 mb SQL(Database) space
    6. MySQL hosting(not necessary , but for future-proofing), with optional availability of PHP scripting(current host offers a website that can feature all three(ColdFusion&Pyhton) in the same site)
    7. Atleast 80GB per month bandwidth
    8. And domain name registration facility, along with atleast 20 subdomains
    9. Moste Importante : 2 or more FTP accounts and an SMTP,POP3 & forwarding accounts for use from within code

  6. Get your host in order and get a ControlPanel offerred by most Hosts(usually it is the HELM control panel for windows hosting)
  7. From this controlpanel you create your database file and create a user and password for it.
  8. To transfer schema and data from your current Visual Studio created Database to your host database you need:
    1. DTSWizard available as part of MSSQL Express Toolkit [ C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\90\DTS\Binn\DTSWizard.exe ] http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId= C243A5AE-4BD1-4E3D-94B8-5A0F62BF7796&DisplayLang=en
    2. SSMSE(SQL Server Management Studio Express) if you're using the free express editions everywhere like I am http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId= C243A5AE-4BD1-4E3D-94B8-5A0F62BF7796&DisplayLang=en
    3. Both of these expect MSXML 6.0, MS SQL 2005 Express Edition, Visual Studio, .NET FX >2.0 to be present on your computer already.
    4. Using the name of the sql server your host has provided(eg: discountsql.discountasp.net) you can connect your management studio and DTSWizard to their server.
    5. Use DTSWizard to transfer all your tables, views, and the data.
    6. Use SSMSE to create a .sql file for your StoredProcs (from Generate script option you get from selecting all the storedprocs)
    7. Delete all comments in this .sql file and execute it in the remote database using the SSMS

  9. Once your data schema and functionality(tables,views,relationships,storedprocs) are uploaded into the host database, download an FTP software for your web site file(CuteFTP, FileZilla)
  10. Change the connection strings in the web.config files and in the code files to point to your new database in the host(They would probably have given you an example)
  11. Then upload all files to the wwwroot folder in your virtual directory , which is seen in the ftp client after providing the ftp connection details your Host has given
  12. Then try out your domain name in the browser to check for any nonconformities, errors and smoothen 'em out. The domain name will take atleast 2-3 days to spread through the internet
  13. Css works in different browsers differently. Different resolutions will give odd renderings.. check all these out and hook up Google Analytics and AdSense if necessary

Make it more accessible to everyone else who may not agree with you? Youd get a lot more people behind this if you just stopped making general statements.

comment.author: gold jewelry
comment.content: Will even my children be able to use Natural Dog Training techniques? Natural Dog Training also includes the children. Because it uses communication in place of force, Natural Dog Training can even be used by young children - as can be seen in the Home Movie Before and After Learning Dog Language. Pam tells families two things: One, the most important family member (the dog being a family member), is the youngest child. Not the dog. The dog must be 100% trustworthy and gentle around all babies and toddlers, even when adults are not present. It is not possible or practical never to leave a child alone with a dog. The dog must fit in with them, not the other way around.. All children must be able to play, run, leave toys on the floor - and the dog must not have any desire to chase them or chew their toys. The onus is not on the child to be safe around dogs. It is on the dog to be safe around children - and this is easily and gently achieved when Nature's Formula for Obedience is applied.. Next, Pam tells families - if the strongest person in the family or the one who can shout the loudest can handle the dog, he or she had better stay at home all day in case they are needed to control the dog! (Then who is going to go to work to earn money to buy his dog food!) But if the youngest member of the family can control the dog - Dad - and the person with the anger disorder can too. Sound impossible? From our current mindset of controlling the dog - it is. Working with the dog's instincts instead of against them - it is not at all impossible.
